title: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: Bug 6322: All types dialog shows obfuscated classes. JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc.
OB: When using the Open Type dialog, the obfuscated classes ('a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd') are prominently displayed.
EB: The Open Type dialog should not prominently display the obfuscated classes.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the Open Type dialog.
2. Observe the prominent display of the obfuscated classes ('a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd').

Options to resolve the bug:
a) Sort the lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.
b) Filter out the obfuscated classes completely.

I suggest option 'a'.
